mods.note: David French Boyd joined the faculty of Louisiana State Seminary of Learning at Alexandria, Louisiana, in 1860 under the administration of William T. Sherman. After serving in the Confederate Army during the Civil War, he was appointed superintendent and later president of the Seminary by Governor J. Madison Wells. Boyd resigned this position in 1880, returning to the University in 1884." Robert C. Wickliffe was governor of Louisiana between 1856 and 1860." George Mason Graham was a planter of Tyrone Plantation, Rapides Parish, La., and a member of the Board of Supervisors of the State Seminary of Learning at Alexandria, La.
